revised_title: Investigating the Difference of Potential in the Ground Above a Buried Metal Charge from a High-Pressure Electric Light Supply
tldr: This study investigates the potential difference in the ground above a buried metal charge from a high-pressure electric light supply. The authors found that the potential difference between points 4 ft. apart on the surface was over 20% of the total potential difference used to charge the pipe. The results highlight the potential dangers of electrical energy supply and the importance of proper insulation and grounding.
